com.example.octofy

Class TagCloud

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.LinearLayout
          • com.example.octofy.TagCloud
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class TagCloud
extends android.widget.LinearLayout

    TagCloud

    TagCloud is an extended LinearLayout, built to display a data set of tags.
    See Also:
    Tag, LinearLayout

    • Method Detail

      • updateTags

        public void updateTags()
        Updates the tags on the screen. The arraylist of tags must not be empty. If the array is empty nothing is done. The tags will be drawn with the text and text color specified in the tag object. The font size will be calculated depending of the count of the tag and the count of the rest of the counts in the array. The number of tags on one row depends on the sizes of the tags.
        See Also:
        Tag

      • setData

        public void setData(java.util.ArrayList<Tag> tagArrayList)
        Set or update data in the data set. The tag cloud will be updated after the data set is changed.
        Parameters:
        tagArrayList - the new data set of tags
        See Also:
        Tag

      • setMaxFontSize

        public void setMaxFontSize(int maxFontSize)
        Set the wanted max font size of the tag cloud. The tag cloud will be updated.
        Parameters:
        maxFontSize - The wanted maximum text size.

      • setMinFontSize

        public void setMinFontSize(int minFontSize)
        Set the wanted min font size of the tag cloud. The tag cloud will be updated.
        Parameters:
        minFontSize - The wanted minimum text size.

      • setTagPadding

        public void setTagPadding(int t,
                          int r,
                          int b,
                          int l)
        Set the wanted padding for the tags. The tag cloud will be updated.
        Parameters:
        t - Top padding
        r - Right padding
        b - Bottom padding
        l - Left padding

      • addTag

        public void addTag(Tag t)
        Add a new tag to the data set. The tag cloud will be updated.
        Parameters:
        t - The new tag to be added to the data set
